english.question: [Error Detection] He is senior than me in service, so I obey his advice.
[Error Detection] Neither the boy nor his parents was willing to go to the village.
[Idiom and Phrases] The soldier was ready to lay down his life for the country.
[Idiom and Phrases] He always speaks his mind.
[Synonym] Choose the synonym of: Eloquent
[Antonym] Choose the antonym of: Generous
[Synonym] Choose the synonym of: Rapid
[Antonym] Choose the antonym of: Frequent
[Active and Passive Voice] She writes a letter.
options: A letter has been written by her.
A letter was being written by her.
A letter is written by her.
A letter is being written by her.

english.question: [Active and Passive Voice] They will build a house next year.
options: A house will be built next year.
A house is built next year.
A house has been built next year.
A house was being built next year.

english.question: [Question Tag] She can drive well, ______?
[Question Tag] He rarely speaks, ______?
[Direct and Indirect Speech] He said, “I will go to school tomorrow.”
options: He said that he will go to school tomorrow.
He said that he would go to school the next day.
He said that he goes to school the next day.
He said he would have gone to school tomorrow.

english.question: [Direct and Indirect Speech] She said, “I am cooking dinner.”
options: She said that she is cooking dinner.
She said that she had cooked dinner.
She said that she was cooking dinner.
She said she has been cooking dinner.

english.question: [Correct Spelling] Choose the correctly spelled word:
[Correct Spelling] Choose the correct spelling:

[Fill in the Blanks - Preposition] He has been absent _____ Monday.

[Sentence Arrangement] Rearrange: doctor / the / good / is / a / she
options: She is the doctor a good.

english.question: [Error Detection] Each of the boys have completed the task.
[Antonym] Choose the antonym of: Abundant
[Synonym] Choose the synonym of: Brave
[Direct and Indirect Speech] He said, “Do you like coffee?”
options: He asked if you like coffee.
He said if you liked coffee.
He asked if I liked coffee.

english.question: [Active and Passive Voice] Do they sell books here?

[Correct Spelling] Choose the correct spelling:
[Idiom and Phrases] He is a man of letters.

[Sentence Arrangement] Rearrange: book / the / table / kept / was / on
options: The book was kept on the table.
Was the book on kept the table.
The table was on kept the book.
On the book kept was the table.

english.question: [Error Detection] He prefers tea than coffee.
[Antonym] Choose the antonym of: Polite
[Synonym] Choose the synonym of: Authentic
[Direct and Indirect Speech] He said to me, “Open the window.”
options: He said me to open the window.
He told me to open the window.
He asked me if to open the window.
He asked me open the window.

english.question: [Active and Passive Voice] She had completed the report.
options: The report had been completed by her.
The report has been completed by her.
The report is completed by her.
The report will be completed by her.
